cleaned_text: Supporter, AIDS/LifeCycler This Sunday's adventure began 8 months ago. On June 4th, I'll join nearly 3,000 cyclists & volunteers for the [AIDS/LifeCycle](https://www.linkedin.com/company/aidslifecycle?trk=public_post-text) (ALC), an annual event benefitting two nonprofits doing incredible work for communities in need. ALC is a 7-day, 545-mile bike ride from SF to LA. Several friends have done this event in past years, and I've gladly sponsored them, but I always wondered, "Wow, what kind of person signs UP for such a thing???" Then last September, when a dear friend invited me to ride with him, I learned that *I* am that kind of person. I'm also within striking distance of the fundraising goal I set for myself. It seemed a pipe dream early on, but with the generosity of a kind-hearted network, I hope to close the gap to $15k: [https://lnkd.in/gs5wuHQF](https://lnkd.in/gs5wuHQF?trk=public_post-text) — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — What has it meant to prep for this ride? — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — I procured a road bike in October, fell twice learning to clip in to my pedals, and eventually mastered trial-by-fire gear shifters. By April, I marveled at my progress, routinely riding 5-7 hours at a time, over 75-105 miles, scaling 4k+ feet elevation gain. Wait, WHAT?!? Then reality hit. April's highs met May's lows; an ache in my left knee worsened, sidelining me for 3(!) weeks. MRI scans confirmed a nasty case of IT band syndrome. Ouch. ALC 2023 kicks off this Sunday. I haven't fully recovered, but I've thrown the kitchen sink at my challenge: cross-training, chiro, PT, acupuncture, massage, kinesio taping, orthotics, megadose NSAIDs, stretching, rolling, ice, heat, salves, unguents, tinctures.... Then last week, for the first time since April 29, I resumed pedaling — initially on stationary bikes, then outdoors for a few hours. The knee is holding up! At most, a hint of pain. I've got this. So, mindset shift: I may not ride all 545 miles next week, but I'll cover as many as I can with minimal pain, all 7 days. But this isn't about me. It's about the incredible work that the good folks at [San Francisco AIDS Foundation](https://www.linkedin.com/company/san-francisco-aids-foundation?trk=public_post-text) & [Los Angeles LGBT Center](https://www.linkedin.com/company/l-a--gay-&-lesbian-center?trk=public_post-text) do year-round. Huge gratitude to them, and to everyone joining me in supporting them! Follow for updates from the road next week....
